definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: To look at ourselves in the mirror often will be very beneficial.
sentences.chinese: 经常照镜自省将让我们受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Undoubtly, college students have benefited a lot from social practice.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，大学生从社会实践中已经受益匪浅。

sentences.english: ACED: What is the most rewarding experience you have had during your career?
sentences.chinese: 在你的事业生涯里，有过什么让你受益匪浅的经历呢？

sentences.english: I have benefited a lot from reading.
sentences.chinese: 广坊蹬漳读使我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Perhaps the brutalised country he has done so much to impoverish might even benefit too.
sentences.chinese: 也许遭受他残酷统治的国家也会受益匪浅。

sentences.english: All of us benefit greatly from this surge of human energy and aptitude.
sentences.chinese: 这些人才的热情和才能的爆发令我们受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Vivi: So that is how it is. I benefited much from today’s talk.
sentences.chinese: 原来如此，今天的谈话真是让我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Thank you for living a life so bold and teaching us so many lessons along the way.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你如此英勇地活过这令我们受益匪浅的一生。

sentences.english: After all, Spitzer had graduated from his role as prosecutor.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，斯皮策的检察官职位使他受益匪浅。

sentences.english: I enjoyed the great benefit of his instructions concerning the matter.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上他的指教使我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: I found much of my laboratory training at RIT to be extremely rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 我发现自己的实验室经验让我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: I enjoyed the great benefit of his instructions concerning the matter.
sentences.chinese: 在这一问题上他的指教使我受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Breaking the habit of self-criticism can pay big dividends in mental and physical health.
sentences.chinese: 克服自责的习惯可以令你的身心都受益匪浅。
你的思想也将受益匪浅。

sentences.english: Trip to the Labor Technology Center, we benefit.
sentences.chinese: 这次来劳技中心，我们受益匪浅。

definition: murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
what one has learned (through experience, reading etc)/knowledge/insight/understanding/tips/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
bringing great benefits (idiom); very useful/of great service/to help greatly/to serve one well
to explain a complicated subject matter in simple terms (idiom)/(of language) simple and easy to understand
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
